Reviews.Title: “Bring ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: daviddduck
Reviews.Content: The hotel is actually a motel and the windows only have bug screen and no glass, so when the bar next door have their live band playing every night till' sometimes 2 am. you better have some good ear plugs. Toilet blocks every day and we are careful not to throw paper in there but still had problems. The place looks nice but once you get to know it....

Reviews.Title: “Too Loud to Sleep on 5th Ave”
Reviews.Author: TravelTime619
Reviews.Content: The hotel was the same price as hostels nearby, but with the amenities of a hotel. The European showers made it hard to get ready (the toilet, shower and sink are all in the same room, but the shower has no doors and drains into the floor). The location is ideal right on the main strip, a block from the beach and near restaurants. The downside of this spot is also the location. There is a bar attached that plays loud music until midnight each night and it will vibrate the room as well. If you're planning on being out late then it shouldn't be a problem. The wifi is non-existent at this spot, but Starbucks is right across the way for anything important. The garden is a pretty jungle set up set back inside the street and the staff is nice. I doubt I would stay here again because of the shower and noise situation.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: judaee
Reviews.Content: We had 2 stops in Playa del Carmen on our trip to Mexico and on the second one we checked into this hotel due to its proximity to 5th Ave and the beach. The location was definitely great with the beach only a few minutes walk and bars/restaurants on its door step. There is a fun bar next door which had live music both nights we stayed. This is great if you like the nightlife but it means that the hotel is not quiet. Beach towels and a safe key can be provided but you need to provide a cash deposit. We selected an air conditioned room which was definitely a wise move. But, the room was pretty dark and seemed to have a ridiculous number of mosquitoes. We didn't have too many issues because we used a lot of repellant and my partner would do a big mosquito kill each evening before we went out for dinner. I guess they were let in each day by the cleaner when the doors/windows were open.

Reviews.Title: “not as good as our last visit”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterKarenT
Reviews.Content: we stayed at 3 places in Playa 2 years ago, and loved Posada Freud (giving it a good review on this site) and so headed back there this year. Last time we felt that we had a great room at a good price, with the only pitfall being the late (3am), loud music. Sadly,we felt it had let itself go a bit this visit. We walked right on past as the whole front was in darkness, not even the hotel sign was lit up and the reception guy was sat in the dark. We had our old room- minus the fridge (which was replaced) and hot water (which we never got). The crockery was much depleted and the cutlery was down to 2 forks and a spoon. The loud music also went on later than our first visit, heard even through ear-plugs. We had planned 4 more days there at the end of our holiday, but found a bigger, quieter, cheaper room with full self-catering utensils. Sorry Posada, our love of you has waned.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the loud Playa del Carmen, we found a peaceful nest.”
Reviews.Author: cedricbd
Reviews.Content: I went there with my girlfriend four the last 2 days of our vacations in the Playa del Carmen area. I was cheap but still very clean and quiet. The hotel itself is accessible by an "alley" between a converse shop and a bar on he 5th avenue so the real facade is hidden from most tourists eyes. The only bad comment I can give (I had to find one) is that we had problems using the (free) wifi. I recommend this hotel for any couple or family who want to stay in playa, but still be able to escape its loud and crowded streets for a few hours of good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: oomsomsoms
Reviews.Content: it is a wonderful hotel, with clean rooms, and the price is perfect. i loved the location. thnx for everything. i loved my vacations so much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull place to be ,clean , friendly helpfull people , tastefully styled.”
Reviews.Author: saskiajansen
Reviews.Content: We have been comming to Posada Freud for the last 17 years and we have seen it grow from a rusticplace into a wonderfull hotel with comfortable rooms . All rooms are different with there own special touch. The place is clean and right on the main street so the beach and everything you need is nearby. There is planty interesting places to visit. Like the Mayan ruins and beautifull sweetwater senotes . Posada Freud is the place to be if you want a lot off everything. Beach ; Culture; Shopping ; Going Out ; Nature and Diving and most important Friendly people .

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pete918
Reviews.Content: Except for a minor ant problem (management was addressing), I could not fault the experience. Music from the adjacent business was rather loud, but then, if you're looking for a quiet retreat, why would you pick a place on 5th ave.? Of the several places I've stayed in Playa, this is the one I would choose again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great ask for t Value”
Reviews.Author: sunworshipper4460745
Reviews.Content: This is a great poseda right in the heart of Playa del Carmen. We walked to everything. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They have a lovely garden within the walls. It is noisy until midnight or so but that was not a problem for us as we were usually out and about until then!

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate Ending”
Reviews.Author: evilmosquito
Reviews.Content: Summary: Hotel with nice location, large balcony, but also has a serious ant problem. My girlfriend and I spent 3 nights of our 10 day tour of the Yucatan at Hotel Posada Freud. We stayed in a suite on the 2nd level looking out onto 5th ave, furthest away from the neighboring restaurant/bar. Here are the good things about the hotel and room. It is located in a great location on 5th ave. If you like “people watching” the suite facing 5th ave is great for that. The suite has good A/C system and ceiling fan that cools the room quickly and has a fridge. We found it to be a reasonable price, $85. (The price ranges of places we stayed on our trip were from $40-$100) Posada Freud fell in the middle. The balcony is larger than most on 5th ave. It has room for a table, two chairs and a hammock. The suite next to us, closest to the neighboring restaurant/bar, has a very large balcony for Playa standards, probably twice the size of ours. We looked at both suites and selected the one furthest away from the restaurant/bar because it was quieter. That said, you can still easily hear the restaurant/bar music and it does have great live bands which we listened to on our balcony each night before going out. The hotel also has a small bar of its own where the bartenders also serve as the hotel staff. The staff was very friendly in both roles as hotel reception and bartenders. The maid service was good. There are two minor criticisms about the hotel and one very problematic one, which is why the title of this review is "Unfortunate Ending." First the minor criticisms, the shower water is difficult to achieve a nice medium between hot and cold, and the hot water only lasted about 7-10 minutes. It was sunny and hot in Playa anyway, so this wasn't a huge deal for us, but may be for others. The other minor criticism is that you can feel the springs in the bed through the cushion. We remedied this by sleeping on top of the supplemental blankets that were provided in the room, but the bed was still not very comfortable. One night I slept outside in the hammock, but I did that mostly for the novelty of it and because I had a few cervesas and thought it would be a good idea at the time, not really to avoid the bed. Before describing our "Unfortunate Ending," I want mention one of the funniest things that I have seen in my 3 trips to Mexico that happened at Hotel Posada Freud. On the second night of our stay three Mexican guys who said they were finishing up a business trip rented the suite next to us with the huge balcony for two days. These guys were very friendly, had a huge bottle of tequila which must have been 3 feet tall (just less than 1 meter) and were hitting it pretty hard. My girlfriend and I talked with them for while over the balcony and then went out dinner. Before we left our new neighbors were calling down over the balcony to mariachi bands requesting songs. We left and went to dinner. We got back to the hotel about 2 hours later and our neighbors had drank about ¼ of the huge bottle of tequila and now had a full blown mariachi band on their balcony singing their crazy Mexican songs. It was hilarious! The band was up there for hours and it probably would have been annoying later b/c they were so loud, but I had enough cervesas so it didn’t matter. This was also the same night I slept in the hammock . . . OK, so as described in the title, our stay at Hotel Posada Freud had an unfortunate ending. On the last night of our stay, the night before we were flying back home, we went to bed “early” around 10pm. At about midnight I woke up and told my girlfriend that I felt like I was being bit. It was dark in the room, and I first thought it was probably a mosquito, but the pain was much greater that a typical mosquito bite. As I was lying in the bed deciding whether to get up, I felt another painful bite so I got up to kill this “mosquito.” When I turned on the lights what I saw was disgusting. Ants were everywhere! These ants were large ½ inch in size (1.25 cm) and I estimate there were 50+ ants crawling around the floor of the suite. They were in the main bedroom area as well as the bathroom. I started to kill them but then realized my efforts were fruitless, there were too many. These ants were not hovering around a food source or in an ant line like you normally see them. These ants were just scattered at random throughout the floor running in all directions. I did not see any ants in the bed after I turned on the lights, but can only presume that the ants are what bit me. I took off my shirt and looked in the mirror; I had two large bite marks on my back, each about 2 inches (5 cm) in diameter. I showed them to my girlfriend who gasped at my marks. I told my girlfriend that we needed to check out immediately, by this time it was about 12:15am. She began to pack our things and I went down to the reception desk. I explained the ant problem to the desk clerk. I told him that I either wanted to switch rooms or check out. He offered me the room next to mine, the one right next to the restaurant/bar with the live music. I knew that if we switched the music would prohibit us from sleeping and I did not trust that if there was an ant problem in our room that there would not be one in the room next to us. I asked to pay for our prior nights and to check out. I told the clerk I did not want to pay for the current night. He refused and said that since he could not rent the room at 12am that I had to pay for it. I protested his point and he asked if I had left food out in the room. None, I said. 100% of any small food items we had were kept in the fridge and we were extremely neat about cleaning up after we had eaten. (I am a property manager for a living and know full well the concerns of food and pests.) He then asked to see the ants in our room. I showed him the room and the ants that I had killed, but by this time there no living ants crawling around anymore as they likely crawled into crevices when the lights were turned on. He said he couldn’t see any ants and went down stairs to his reception desk. He again stated that he would have to charge me for the current night. I protested again and showed him my bite marks. He asked if I would be willing to speak with the owner. I told him I was perfectly willing to do this. He called someone, I presume the owner, and came back a few minutes later and said that I could pay for previous nights and could check out, no payment required for the current night. I never spoke with the owner. I paid him for the prior nights and checked out. On my way out the door the reception clerk apologized to me for the ants and told me that the building is treated for pests. We walked over to a nearby hotel and checked in there just before 1am. The rest of night was fine. We had seen a rogue ant here and there during the first few days of our stay at Hotel Posada Freud, but those I just killed them, no big deal. It was the large quantity of ants on our last night and the fact that I was being bit that caused us to leave. It was very peculiar and I have no idea why the ants came out in such large numbers on the last night of our trip. Had it not been for the ants on the last night I would have been satisfied with our stay, but when I look for a hotel room, the two basic things that are most important to me is that it is clean and free of pests. Since the basic need of keeping a room free of pests was not met, any and all other positive aspects of the hotel, to me, are moot. Because of this I will not be staying at Hotel Posada Freud in the future and caution any other travelers who are considering a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Find”
Reviews.Author: levi760
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our mid-20s and try to take a trip about every 6 months. I usually do the extensive research and happened to find this nice little place right in the middle of everything. We rented the Suite 192 for seven nights and had a great stay. Like I mentioned, the hotel is in the middle of everything and a short walk from the ADO bus station (safe & great deal). It is really nice and well done. The only down side is the loud live music played nightly next door (9pm-12am if I remember correctly). The musicians are great but can be a downer if your the type that likes to wind down earlier than most in Playa. Great Value. We are already trying to get a group of friends to go next year and we will stay at Posada Freud for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem on 5th Avenue - Hotel Posado Freud”
Reviews.Author: Loshkaj
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at this hotel for 10days. The staff are very friendly and always willing to give advice on all maters ie. travel. The effort the owner goes to on all the little things around the property and in the room are beautiful. I would strongly recommend staying at this property as it is excellent value in a great location. Situated on 5th Avenue but set in a beautiful garden surrounding. Good luck and enjoy Mexico!!

Reviews.Title: “Rock us to sleep”
Reviews.Author: PJLetsRock
Reviews.Content: When we first started trawling the Internet for a hotel in Playa Del Carmen, this was actually the first hotel we found. Even though we went on to check out numerous hotels on the Net, this is the one we decided upon.We booked it without any problem several months ago and have regularly looked at their site in the months leading up to the holiday. When we got there the hotel was exactly how we imagined it. We were lucky enough to get (in our opinion) the best room - the studio in room 5. This has a balcony (+ hammock) overlooking 5th Avenue, a massive bed, a great shower, a fridge for cooling those drinks and plenty of room to relax. We spent a lot of time on the balcony observing the activity on the street below.The room was cleaned every day and the maids used to arrange the towels in the shape of swans etc. We read all the earlier reviews complaining about the noise, particularly the rock bands playing the bar next door, but this did not bother us at all. In fact we liked it, even managing to fall asleep on the balcony on one occasion whilst cover versions of AC/DC, Bon Jovi and similar tunes were blasting out next door. The hotel is in an excellent location and is good value for money. All the staff were helpful and friendly and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it , love it, love it.”
Reviews.Author: morenarpmty
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice, cozy, clean, relaxing, affordable hotel thats right in the middle of everything, then this is it!..... I think of it as a tree house for grown ups. It is nestled between huge trees and all the bed rooms have a patio or terrace with a hameck but at the same time it has all the amenities thats you will need from a hotel. I discovered playa del carmen earlier this year at the same time the first hotel i stayed at was hotel posada freud, i've now been there 3 times and every time i try 1 or 2 new hotels but always manage to spend at least one night here, the staff is great and the rooms are always super clean, not to mention that the rooms are all a little bit different so you always get a nice surprise. I plan to be back soon, hopefully in december for my birthday and be sure i will be visiting hotel posada freud one more time:)

Reviews.Title: “affordable and charmful hotel right in the hot-spot of Playa”
Reviews.Author: astravski
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I did a round-trip in Yucatan this July wich started off at the Posada Freud in Playa (as we were told to leave out Cancun). As it turned out this was a perfect match for us as the Posada Freud is right in the center spot of Playa, meaning close to the beach, bars and restaurants we enjoyed so much. Moreover, we love the character of this small hotel which we prefer to the huge and (in our view) anonymous all-inclusive tourist-towers we saw all over the coast of this beautiful peninsula. Our room was clean and very charming - it had AC, a fridge and a nice balcony. Concerning the noise issue: In contrast to some other reviewers we even enjoyed the bars and the live music next to the hotel which added up to our vacation feeling. Sure, this depends on individual needs - but in a holiday, in that kind of a city, we prefer not to go to sleep before midnight anyway. When trying to have a quiet and peaceful holiday I am not exactly sure if I would decide for Playa at all as it is the vibrating life is which makes this city so attractive. Anyway, what made our stay complete (and the reason for my first tripadvisor review) was the help of the hotel owner Christine. She is originally from Austria and therefore speaks German. She was very helpful in giving us advice and tips for our trip through Yucatan demonstrating a huge amount of local knowledge and pointing out some nice beaches, cenotes, maya-sites and so forth, which was a big help for us. We even returned to the Posada Freud in the middle of our trip on our way back up towards the Isla de Mujeres (recommendation!). We were suprised that our second double-room looked almost completely different, again having a very charmful atmosphere. So if you are looking for an affordable and unique place with a helpful and fun staff right in the hot-spot of Playa this is the place (or at least, a great place) to go!!

Reviews.Title: “Are you ready to find some peace after 2:00 am”
Reviews.Author: Maya067
Reviews.Content: Basically I can say that I reserved for a two bedroom and I got one bedroom, I mentionned this to the owner which only told me every room is different and could not describe all of them in the website.. (which is misleading people.. it read you may have one queen OR two doubles... anyway.. other than this "good surprise", I got my second one... only could find some peace after 2:00 am, as there is a bar by the entrance and they close by 2:00.. So if you stay there make sure to ask the description of the room.. don t assume that the website is right.. and better join the party!!

Reviews.Title: “best place we stayed in playa”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterKarenT
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write about our stay here for some time as I think this place deserves praise (this will be the only place I have posted about), but I am a little lazy around computers. We stayed in two other places in playa- the first rating much higher in this list, but we loved it here. I would recommend not staying on the ground floor as the rooms in the upper floors are so much nicer. Yes, there is noise from next door, but the rooms are lovely, they have a small kitchen area and a huge balcony. If we ever get back to Playa this wll be where we stay

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay with great location as long as you don't want an early night”
Reviews.Author: lechou
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Posada Freud and thought the rooms and surrounding area was very nice. We stayed there over New Year and the best aspect for us was the location. This however, has it's downside as the bar next door has live bands playing until midnight and beyond but this did not particularly bother us as all but the last night (when we had to be up early to catch a bus to Tulum) we did not get back until 1 - 2am. The place is quite difficult to find as the entrance is through their small bar and we walk pasted it 2 or 3 times. We got there quite late at night but had no problems checking in. There was a bit of a miss understanding over the room we booked, we decided to leave this until the next day to resolve, when were relocated without any fuss and the new room was great. We read some of the comments about theft so, as we would in any other hotel, used the free safe deposit box at reception for passports and other valuables. We were given a receipt with a full itemised account of our belongings and all was return safely when we checked out. I would recommend this hotel but only to people visiting PDC to enjoy the nightlife as well as the beach

Reviews.Title: “You will never regret your stay at the Posada Freud”
Reviews.Author: FireWomanUsa
Reviews.Content: My family and I (group totaling 4 people) stayed in the penthouse for one week at the Posada Freud. The penthouse is amazing! It was so big, we could have comfortably added a few more people and still never get in each others way. The penthouse is designed and decorated very uniquely. You will truly feel at home from the moment you arrive. The location of this hotel cannot be beat. Although the penthouse has a kitchen, which I planned on using for cooking meals, I never did use it once. The restaurants readily available in Playa Del Carmen quickly changed my mind about cooking. The food choices were plentiful, excellent and so convenient with hardly a walk to each favorite restaurant. But, in the event someone did want to cook in the kitchen, it was equipped nicely and was clean. My family and I have been traveling between Cancun, Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel for many years. I believe this was our 49th or 50th trip. Each of us has our own preferences on how to spend our time while on vacation. The location of the Posada Freud made it possible for each person to do what they wanted, and easily meet up at the bar without feeling like we were waiting on each other all week. There was no hassle of taking a taxi every time you wanted to go to dinner or to come home late at night after partying at a club. Some may think that the noise level is an issue while staying right on the 5th. If you are a person who needs absolute quiet to sleep, and you like to be in bed sleeping before midnight, then maybe you should invest in a cheap pair or earplugs. Personally, I found the live music from the club next door to be a great addition to my vacation. The music was wonderful and it added to my experience. I enjoyed relaxing on the terrace and having drinks with family and friends while being entertained by the live band. The staff at the Posada Freud are very friendly and helpful for any situation. From the moment you meet them, you feel appreciated and welcomed. The feeling of a smaller hotel cannot be beat when the staff know your name and greet you with a smile every time you return to your room. The staff are helpful with any request. While we were vacationing, Mexico had record breaking cold weather. The owners of the hotel brought extra blankets to us to be sure we were warm at night. I cannot wait for another vacation to the Posada Freud. After traveling to Mexico many times, staying in many types of hotels, I have finally found the one I will return to time and time again. I would be comfortable staying in a smaller room if I were to travel alone or with another person. But, if vacationing with a group, I would certainly ask for the penthouse once again. It feels like a special get-away home tucked into the trees. The only people I would not recommend this room for is anyone who may have a broken leg in a full cast. The stairs may be difficult for you to climb... for for anyone else, go for it! You will not regret it. Shannon O'Brien

Reviews.Title: “get a local feel to Mexico with the friendliest staff anywhere and lovely rooms with hammocks-great location on 5th ave”
Reviews.Author: 00tennis
Reviews.Content: Miguels Margaritas (made with reel fresh limes) are legendary....place has so much character and staff are so helpful/friendly....do anything for you....I have recommended this place on twitter and a lot of websites....also amazing value

Reviews.Title: “Would have no hesitation staying again!”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad293
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at Hotel Posada Freud once or twice a year for nearly fifteen years. When I am in Playa del Carmen this is my home away from home. Most recently (August) I brought my 79 year old mother here for her first visit to Playa. She loved this hotel and would not consider staying anywhere else. Each room is clean, beautiful, individual and unique. I've found the staff and owners to be polite, friendly, honest and helpful in every instance. This is not a foo foo hotel. If you require monogramed linnen, bathrobes, irons at a moments notice, and a tuxedo wait staff that trips over themselves to wait on your every whim, you are better off at one of the many heartless mega resorts that line the resort strip. This is an honest family run hotel offering a safe beautiful place to stay for a reasonable rate. If a washcloth is not delivered to your room in seconds, are you really going to let it ruin your stay? Relax, you are in Mexico. Is it noisy at night? Sure. The bar next door plays carribean Cubano music or live acoustic guitar until midnight some nights. I rarely grow tired of the music but if have to sleep earplugs are an easy fix. In fifteen years, I've never had a problem with the honesty of the maid staff. If I leave any money around it is always placed in a cup or bowl on the counter for my return. Try Posada Freud. You will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Posada Freud Rocks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnattwell
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Playa del Carmen...give Posada Freud serious consideration....we thought it was the perfect location....right on 5th Ave where all the restaurants, bars, stores and all the fun in Playa is, in addition to being near the beach. The staff is friendly and efficient....the "Little Bar" that is attached to the Hotel is really fun. We met the owners too and they could not be nicer nor more considerate. We strongly recommend Posada Freud! We shall return!

Reviews.Title: “A lot of Bang for the Buck/Peso!”
Reviews.Author: Jack134
Reviews.Content: Posada Freud is great! Comfortable, clean, warm and friendly staff. It is located right on the main drag and only a stones throw from the beach. Ground zero for fun!

Reviews.Title: “We Love Posada Freud!!!”
Reviews.Author: tripcomments
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Playa for years. Posada Freud is located right in the heart of 5th Avenue, a perfect location for shopping, eating or walking to the beach. The rooms are always clean and the staff friendly. There is a small bar at the entrance, on 5th Avenue which is a fabulous place to hang out and meet locals and tourists a like. There are two adorable chihuahuas that are always fun to see as well. We highly recommend Posada Freud, it is clean, reasonable, and well located. They can also help you arrange for fishing trips, or any other kind of activity that you may be interested in

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Posada Freud!”
Reviews.Author: bassface
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights the first week of June in room #3 and it was great! We originally booked a room with no A/C and upgraded to one with A/C no problem! It was just $5 more per night, no big deal. The room was clean and larger than expected. A $10 deposit will get you big beach towels and another $10 deposit will get you a key for the room safe. We got it all back after our stay was up. We had booked 5 nights but cancelled 2 nights prior to arrival because we wanted to stay in Cozumel for a couple days and Ivan refunded the two nights when we arrived, again, no problem!!! The room was cleaned very well each day and we were very happy. Room #3 is directly across from where the live music plays every night but we just jumped in our hammock and listened, it was great! Even if you just wanted to sleep it didn't bother us, after a long day on the beach we were out like a light once we hit the pillows! Posada has a small bar that served ice cold beer too! The hotel is one block from the beach and we spent our days at Zenzi Bar, it was right down the street and they have free chairs and waiters to bring you drinks. Good times!!!

Reviews.Title: “They honor their cancelling policy.”
Reviews.Author: Cndntraveler
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at this hotel, but recently made reservations and sent $140 deposit to reserve a room for a week. After having to cancel my trip, I was hoping they would honor their cancelation policy, and they did. It took a little while because they were having problems with Paypal, but when I finally gave them my credit card number they quickly credited my account. The manager, Ivan, is very courteous and professional. Playa del Carmen is a beautiful place (I visited last December), so must say that if I return I would not hesitate to deal with these people again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Excellent Suite...Can't Beat it For The Price!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bbing420
Reviews.Content: So after many many hours of deal searching we decided that it was better to be centrally located on 5th ave and go to different restaurants every night than to stay a few miles away in an all inclusive. I read the reviews from posada and decided to give it a shot, especially since I heard good things about the suite. Booking was a breeze, email, paypal...done! Got the every so popular suite #5 for 5 nights. Check-in was at about 2 I think and there was a guy sitting in a chair outside and we were in our room in less than 30 seconds. Room was everything you needed. Nice ceramic tile floors, AC, Cable TV, big shower ( although water pressure was a little off but hey its mexico) and big bed with the all notorious rock hard mattress but again...its mexico. The best was the balcony where two french doors open to. There is a hammock where we spent some time napping and the view is great for people watching centrally located on 5th in between 8th and 10th. The room was cleaned everyday by I'd say 3pm and of course we left a couple bucks a day for tip which in turn gets you a spotless room and a nice towel animal...very nice! As far as everyone talking about the noise...yes siesta fiesta is next door but it didnt bother us and the suite is the only room that is open to the front of 5th ave. The sun and margaritas beat us up so bad that we were in bed sound asleep by midnight or so every night and as far as people saying there are mariachi bands playing in the morning or music...we woke up around 10am everyday to go to the beach and people were just opening their shops so again no noise here. Grounds were kept immaculate with a nice courtyard and two family chiuauas running around checkout was easy and a smooth walk to the ADO which by the way is the easiest and cheapest way to get to playa. Overall I must say for the price which I believe was about 90 bucks a night you couldn't ask for more and when I return to playa I will most definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “lovely sweet hotel with the nicest people”
Reviews.Author: adrianus2009
Reviews.Content: the first two nigths we stayed in the suite. we loved the location, the space and the view from the big balcony . also there was a relaxing hammock. after those two nights we stayed in a standard room because the suite was'nt available. this room was also a pleasant place to stay. the service we've got from the staff was perfect managment and staff are very nice and lovely people. we loved the little bar with his great atmosphere and excellent service. the best mojito's on quinta avenida thx miguel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy hotel... NOT recommended if you want to rest”
Reviews.Author: Miminne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was centrally located on the 5th of PDC, and the other options were already full. I have to say that we really regretted it since we arrived. I had asked the room to be ready by 2 pm (check out is at 12). But it wasn't and the dilletante staff didn't seem to mind much. At 6pm, the noise outside was already very high, and we came back to the room at 1 am and there were LOTS of noise from the downstairs bar (drunk people shouting). In the morning, the noise starts at 7am... So we didn't get 5 hours of decent sleep. There is no glass on the windows, just mosquito net, so you hear EVERYTHING going on outside. I recommend staying near mamita's beach or in a perpendicular street to the 5th. You'll walk very little and will have peace and intimacy.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: FinnishMexican
Reviews.Content: I stayed with two friends a week-end in Playa del Carmen. I normally stay at the Kinbe (I highly recommend), but as it was full we opted for Posada Freud. And came to regret it greatly... First of all the noise. I stayed in the suite which is overlooking the 5th av, and felt like I slept in a shop window. There was noise, noise and noise. From the bar beside until 2 am, and from the street as of 7 am (shops opening, a busy cafe is just in front of the hotel etc). So we got almost no sleep during a week-end which was suppost to be for recharging batteries. If you come to Playa to party and need a hotel just to shower, this is the place as the location is good. However I think you can find a shower for less money. And beware, my room atleast had very little hot water so your showers will be cold! Also the cleanliness of the room had a lot to wish for, and the bathroom built into the corner of the room half open would not be very comfortable if you are not staying alone in the room as it provides no privacy. Also I felt that the room lacked maintenance (fosets leaking, shower blocked so you stood in dirty water while showering, riped sheets etc). No, no, no... I visit Playa 3-5 times a year and will NEVER stay in this hotel again. Kinbe Hotel is just as well located and like another world. There is no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Dreaming For 2 weeks in heaven!”
Reviews.Author: CoolCanadians
Reviews.Content: My family has just come back from our 2 weeks in playa! we stayed at a great little hotel on 5th ave for the first week and an all inclusive (terrible ! but we will get to that later) for the second....I did all bookings this time from the net, from flights to hotels to tours (balamcab.com, Henry will take care of you !) we arrived 23rd of Jan and had a private van pick us up at the airport, ordered from balamcab, and took us to our first hotel , it was called the posada freud, the manager there (Aldo) took care of use right away,As I have been talking with Aldo for about 4months by E-mail it was great to finally put a face to him, He set us up with a suite over looking 5th ave ( fantastic balcony with hammock , so it was me (mark) my wife (rose) and our 14 year old daughter (brianna) king bed for us and a pull out couch for our daughter ( yes i know what your all thinking and your right, very close quarters to share with your 14 year old daughter but i am ashamed to say i learn't so much about her that i did not know that i would not have changed it for the world! , Dont get me wrong my wife and i had our moments with her, she is a teenager after all) The Posado freud is a fantastic little hotel with great people looking after it , from the maids up to the management (Aldo) and the owner (christina, what a morning that was when they were putting up there new sign..me and my wife are still laughing )At the end of our week there ,we were trying to come with how we felt about our experience staying there and the only thing we can think of is it was ELECTRIC! would stay there again in a heart beat (next year the penthouse!) well i will post again in a day or 2 about the tours we took (thank you so much Henry from balamcab !) sorry to ramble on,next post will be better including pics thanks

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a place to stay, we found a home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: r8rnation
Reviews.Content: The wife and I are the adventures types, so armed with nothing but a couple of bags and a plane ticket, we flew to Mexico. We arrived in Cancun, and bought a bus ticket down to Playa. Arriving at the bus station, we stepped out on to the coble stone street and wondered which direction to go. We turned left up 5th, and started walking. Our first order of business was to find a room. We happened upon a discrete little boutique hotel, it was Posada Freud. We decided instantly to check in. (I would not try this plan during peak season) Being adventurous, we figured we would stay here for a night or two, until we found something else. As it was our first time in Playa, we really didn’t know what that “something else” was. In the end, we never left. The rooms, service, location and atmosphere was so wonderful, we new this was it. The reception area was quaint clean and friendly. As we headed to our room, we passed through the rod iron gates and into a small paradise. Large trees created a comfortable cool canopy of shade, and the small gardens were vibrant and immaculate. Our room was large and obviously well prepared and cared for. That evening we discovered one of the best things of all. While cozied up together in our large hammock, enjoying some cold beer and tequila that we stocked in our fridge and watching the little chirping geckos hunting for the occasional moth on our even larger balcony, we heard the firs tunings of a live band. Next door is a little bar that plays live covers until midnight. It became our nightly ritual after dinner and exploring, to cozy up and listen to the tunes and enjoy each others company. After 22 years and 4 kids those times are rare indeed. On subsequent trips we have gone back to make it our base of operations while exploring the Yucatan region. Posada Freud is a 3 min walk to the beach, and located so that you are instantly in the middle of all the shopping and dining you could ever want. They will assist and recommend you in getting tours of all the local sights and activities, or you can go to one of the many tour coordinator booths steps from your room. We have met many good friends and had many good times at their quaint little bar. Edguardo and his lovely wife are the owners, and proudly talk about their place while happily sharing a drink with you. In the end, we have found a home away from home. If you are the all inclusive type, Posada Freud is probably not for you, but if you are the type that enjoys friends and exploring a culture and all of its wonders from a place that feels like home; you could not ask for better. J. Konrad Grand Junction Co.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but beware”
Reviews.Author: violet101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Posada for three days. The staff was very friendly, our room was cleaned daily in a timely manner but there a few downfalls to staying here. First, people mentioned the music coming from the Siesta Fiesta bar in previous reviews. Yes, the live band that starts at 6pm every night ends at 12am but the bar music goes on until about 1am then the staff cleans up so noise ceases about 2:30am. The music also starts back up again at 7am, so unless you are a heavy sleeper bring earplugs or be prepared for no sleep. The music was fun in the beginning but after a night of no sleep it became irratating fast. Second, the bed in our room was very, very hard. I woke up a few times with my arms asleep and had bad neck pains for three days. There was a little ant problem in our room along with a lizard that we caught and let go outside. I wrote this off as, "ah we're in Mexico" but under normal circumstances this would not be acceptable. Overall the hotel is quaint and has a certain charm, the price for the location is great if you can deal with the constant noise and music.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room with even lovelier balcony”
Reviews.Author: LiorH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Posada Frued at low season thus got low price and great value for our money, the hotel is right in the middle of everything, we had a simple but beautiful room but the highlight was the huge balcony with chairs, a table and big comfortable hammock. We spent almost half of the time in Playa sitting in this balcony. The hotel is right above an open doors, live music bar so if you plan on going early and quietly to sleep you might want to stay at other place, for us it just added good music to the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: rubylew
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel! My daughter, my nephew and myself booked the penthouse for our stay. Three separate bedrooms, with sleeping options for more and three bathrooms gave us all the space we could want. There is a small kitchen in the penthouse which allowed us to dine in when we wanted to and the central location of the hotel put us withing walking distance of tons of different dining options. The rates are excellent as long as you understand it is not an "AI" and you will be left to your own devices to find things to do while you visit Playa Del Carmen. It worked great for us and I am going back again this November!

Reviews.Title: “Posada Freud is awesome! You will love it!”
Reviews.Author: Surfer267
Reviews.Content: The bar staff, especially Miguel will always take care of you. They are great. The owners Christina and Edguardo are oustanding people, honest, super friendly and fun. They usually hang at the bar and chill in the evening.. cause they just wanna be there too. They atmosphere is great! The place just has great overall feel. The palapas off the upper rooms are a great spot to hang and listen to the music from 5 avenue. Rooms are clean and the suites and penthouse are oustanding. Stay there, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel in the perfect beach town”
Reviews.Author: MsGarb
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Posada Freud at around midnight after a day of travel. Candles were lit in the courtyard and placed into niches in the wall. The place looked magical---and that impression remained for the whole week of our stay. Our room had a wrap around balcony w/ a hammock. The mosaic tiles in the bathroom mimic the aquas and blues of the Caribbean. the AC is great & quiet. The room was beautiful. ...and ohmygoodness, location location, location! The Posada Freud is in the heart of the action in Playa and the beach is only a block away. The bar at the entrance to the Posada is the friendliest and smallest bar in Playa. It is a great place to get the scoop on where to go in and around Playa. Carlos, Miguel and Aldo are all charming and knowledgeable They also know how to make a great Margarita! My husband and I will return to the Posada Freud. I heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Lovely”
Reviews.Author: eatblueberries
Reviews.Content: This unique hotel is located right on 5th Ave in Playa. It is centrally located to be in walking distance to the beach, spa's, shopping, and resteraunts. Walk a couple blocks west and you find the more local eateries. The hotel is staffed with friendly and helpful people. The rooms are clean and BEAUTIFUL! Hammocks on the balconies, interesting artwork. Free bottled water. And it is affordable!! Miguel the bartender pours a mean marguarita and Edwardo (the owner) is often their to greet his treasured guests. There is also a Wii in the "lobby" which is loads of fun after a drink and a long day out. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a true experience of local Playa. Plus, Cafe Sasta across the street has the best coffee in town!

Reviews.Title: “not very surprised...”
Reviews.Author: JorgenM
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend visited the Posada Freud in sept 2006, we stayed for 3 nights if i'm not mistaken. We were very stupid and naive to give our money, airplane tickets, pasports to that Carlos guy... in a plastic bag. He stapled it shut and stocked it in the reception safe... At the end of our stay we asked for our belongings and he gave it to us... 50 EUR was missing... Ok we could not 'prove it' because there was no paper or something that stated how much money we putted in... But the bag was stapled double so it was clear for us that it was opened... we were not drunk or hugging young mexican guys and we knew exactly how much money we had... we had 250 EUR and there was only 200 EUR left... We didn't make a fuzz about it till the other receptionist lady accused us of stealing towels... (what the f***). I tought that was so low... We left the Posada then after paying. I wrote an angry statement in dutch (the owner then was dutch) and received an e-mail answer some weeks later that he would investigate the case... never heard of him again of course... In sept coming we planned to go back to mexico. I was delighted to see on the website there was a new (and by that back the old) management in Posada Freud... We loved the Posada Freud and the atmosphere there so we wanted to forget the thing and go back... Now I see that that little thug Carlito is still working there and still 'doing his job' - he's working there for 12 years already?? - I'm not planning to go back of course...

Reviews.Title: “Another great review of the Posada”
Reviews.Author: TacomaTx07
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Studio 192 room from 6/21 through 6/28 and it was an amazing experience. The studio has its own private glass door entrance right on 5th avenue. It truly feels like you have an apartment on 5th. Once inside you take a winding staircase to the second floor. Everything in the Studio worked great and the tall windows open up a phenomenal view to people watch (if thats your thing). The Studio, as I expected ahead of time, could be loud with the neighboring Siesta Fiesta bar as well as 5th avenue construction that always seems to be going on. Plan to take a nap in the early evening to compensate for lost sleep. I would recommend this unit for couples or any single travelers. Utilizing the sofa bed and the queen bed to sleep 4 might make it a little cozy, especially with such a small bathroom. The housekeepers did an excellent job each day and Carlos and Aldo were very friendly and helpful guys. Two thumbs way up! I wouldnt hesitate staying here again at all!

Reviews.Title: “I got robbed”
Reviews.Author: scoob827
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Playa Del Carmen, Mexico. I went with a couple of girlfriends for my bachelorette party. I thought it was going to be the best vacation. We arrived on a Saturday night, and therefore did not got out. We woke up Sunday morning and left for the beach. We were out for several hours. When we returned to the hotel, i noticed i was missing three hundred dollars from my wallet. The owner came up to our room to discuss the incident and kept accusing us of lying. To say the least from that point on we were getting personally attacked and checked out the following day. They did not refund our money; we had paid in advance. They completely ruined my trip. I would never ever recommend this hotel, they were not at all sympathetic to the situation, nor did they try to solve it.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!”
Reviews.Author: Element_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and i loved this place. The style is great and the price even better! Very clean rooms. We had suite 5 and it was nice the best thing about it was the deck. We liked sitting out there and watching people and listening to the music. And with the doors closed we couldn't hear it so we had no problem sleeping. The pictures above our bed however were very interesting! The only thing i regret is that we could only stay one night. I loved this place and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing little place! My new favorite!”
Reviews.Author: DDASILVA1114
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this place! First, I love the owners, Edgardo and Cristina and the entire staff is absolutely phenomenal! Especially Carlos and Aldo who keep the place running smoothly day and night. I just felt like I lived there and this was my home. :) I originally found Posada Freud online at the ILOVEPLAYA.com website and then booked two days with a friend using the online booking on the hotel's website, which was very easy. Then I began my Spanish classes in Playa and had to move to a residence with other students, but decided to turn right around the very next day to come right back to Posada Freud to stay there instead for a total of two weeks! It is so economical and yet so comfortable that it was incredibly worth it. I felt like I was in someone's home! And since I decided to make that stay on a whim, I was in a position to actually experience a lot of different rooms, because I hadn't made advanced reservations in one specific room. So most of my mornings I'd check out and move to another room. They were so super accommodating, always keeping my bags secure in the office when I checked out and helping me move to my new room when I returned. And I find now I am an expert at this place. :) I have stayed in Rooms 4, 5, 7, 9, 12, 14 AND in the studio! And loved each and every room for it's individual charm. Many have patios or decks, and there are hammocks for lounging. Even the ones without A/C (7 and 9) were really fine in my opinion...as these rooms are decked out with great, high powered fans to help keep it cool. And who stays indoors anyways except to sleep! Last but not least, the best part, is the cute hotel lobby bar. It is the center of gravity. It's so perfect, especially for solo travelers like me to meet new people (or in my case, practice my Spanish and do homework at the bar with Michael, the bartender, Carlos and Aldo! ---over a few Coronas). These were some of my most fun and favorite nights. :) So on the whole, I highly, highly recommend this place. And would be willing to be contacted by fellow travelers if you have any questions about staying here. I WILL RETURN TO POSADA FREUD! No doubt about it, on any and ALL my trips to Playa. :) Thanks to all that made my stay incredible. Dena

Reviews.Title: “great deal at posada freud”
Reviews.Author: mmonkey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have wanted to try out posada freud for a while now and were able to for a short stay around christmas time. First off check in was breeze and the staff were all very friendly and helpfull. It' s a low key laid back kind of place great to get into the flow of mexico, especially for us coming from NYC. We has a standard room and we opted for a/c. The room was nice and clean simply furnished and best of all we had a balcony with a hammock. All this for a price that would not break the bank even at christmas time. The location is great for being right in the middle of it all and there is bar downstairs for a relaxing drink as you watch the world go by. The bar next door can get pretty loud if you want to get to bed early it could be a problem. We were not bothered by it too much but we are used to allot of noise outside our windows. I might consider bringing ear plugs just in case when I return, some nights seem louder than others.

Reviews.Title: “Best value, Right on 5th avenue!”
Reviews.Author: OregonCountry
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Posada Freud twice now. The first time in 2006, we toured several hotels with our criteria being: within a block of 5th ave., within 2 blocks of the beach, nicest place for under $100. After looking at about a dozen hotels that fit this criteria, we settled on Posada Freud. The basic rooms are just that, basic. But the suites are very nice (tile floors, showers, countertops, nice furnishings, each room has a rustic balcony), plenty of room, air conditioned, very clean, all for about $65-70 per night! Also there is a penthouse with 3 bedrooms for $200 per night. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Maid service is excellent. Family owned establishment. Anyway, when we returned in 2007, we stayed our whole vacation there and loved every minute. For those of you who want a swimming pool, they are planning on putting a small pool in the back within a year. Also, they currently don't have TV's in the rooms, but are planning to add them also within a year. (I don't really know why people want to watch TV while in Mexico, or for that matter to swim in a pool when you are one block from the Carribean!) If you just want a clean room for cheap, there are cheaper places on 5th. If you want a nice place that won't cost a fortune, try Posada Freud!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: bmohlman
Reviews.Content: We are avid travelers to the area and have stayed in many budget hotels in the playa del carmen area. We backpacked here to check out Posada Freud and found it met our expectations and was honoring the off season rate of $37 a night with no a/c which was a good deal, so we stayed. The reviews are pretty true to the property. It is a comfortable, charming stay. One downfall is the noise of the bar band next door, but it didnt bother us since we were out till 1am. What did bother us was some man yelling to his wife from his balcony early in the morning. The other downfall was the shower curtain did not reach to the floor and water was all over the floor of the bathroom when I was done. The room was a groundfloor with screen doors and colorful decor with authentic Mexican taste. The garden area was tasteful with hammocks and seating. I would stay again for the price since it is one of the few hotels that remains in the $30 budget range and exceeds the expectations at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value!”
Reviews.Author: gingele
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with Posada Freud. We stayed there for 2 nights in room #3 and wished it was more. Adorable room with a large king bed plus a second double bed, great balcony with hammock, chairs & table, nice sized bathroom, mini fridge, very clean, and great location right in the heart of things on Fifth. Had a/c but we never used it. Ceiling fan & patio doors worked like a champ. And all for under $70 a night in January! We were so thrilled we will be staying in the penthouse for our next family trip to Playa. Oh, and the noise? A non-issue for us. We actually enjoyed opening our baclony doors in the evenings as we showered & dressed for dinner to listen to the music from next door. We never had an issue after returning to our room after a night out. By then the live music would be finished and the place next door might still have some ambient music playing - but not anything that kept either one of us awake. Highly recommend Posada Freud!

Reviews.Title: “Loud music, clueless help”
Reviews.Author: kiddodank
Reviews.Content: Very loud music at bar next door (until late at night). way too loud. then, one of the handymen keyed into our room the next morning to replace a shower head (misundertanding about room number). he saw us there in the bed and instead of apologizing and immediately leaving, he conintued on into the bathroom. told staff about it. they looked shocked and 'empathized' but never apologized. Plenty of better options elsewhere.
